snippet: After a reporter sought e-mails strategizing on the appointment of Cathleen P. Black, the city fought the request, again and again, in the courts.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on New York City lawyers losing fight, for fourth time,  to conceal e-mails about Mayor Michael R Bloomberg’s proposed appointment of Cathleen P Black to position of schools chancellor; 30-month legal battle could cost city $100,000 in legal expenses, and e-mails were released.
lead_paragraph: After a reporter sought e-mails strategizing on the appointment of Cathleen P. Black, the city fought the request, again and again, in the courts.

headline.seo: City Fought 30 Months to Keep E-Mail About Cathleen Black Secret
headline.main: A 30-Month Legal Fight to Conceal E-Mails About a 95-Day Schools Chancellor
headline.print_headline: A 30-Month Legal Fight to Conceal E-Mails About a 95-Day Schools Chancellor
